title: Ticket #2857: Add %v format to classad printing to print value without knowing type
description:
When printing out classad values, especially when using condor_status -format, it is necessary to know the type of an attribute before you can specify the appropriate printf format tag. It would be easier if you could just request that the printing code print the 'value' and use whatever type was appropriate.

I propose adding %v and %V as tags that printf_format.cpp and ad_printmask.cpp understand. %v will mean 'print the value' and %V will mean 'print the value as it would show up in -long format. (i.e strings should be quoted).

This would allow you to do 

condor_status -format "%v" Name -format " %v\n" LastMatchTime
and the first value would print using %s format and the second with %d, because Name is text and LastMatchTime is integer.

Qualifiers to the format tag will behave the same as qualifiers for %s. so "%-12v" would left justify to 12 columns, and "%13.12v" would truncate to 12 columns and right align to 13 columns.
